intro: Conostylis candicans subsp. calcicola, commonly known as the calcicola conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This subspecies is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often on rocky or calcareous soils. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
